"Rainbow" was a hard album for me to reiew. I love JohnnyC ash, and to give anything thate h has done less than 4 stars is tough for me. "Rainbow" was released in 1985 and was Cashs' last album for Columbia. Veteran Memphis producer Chips Moman was given the honors this tmie around. Chips Moman had produced osme incedble R&B hits, as well as bringing Willie Nelson to the masses with "Always on my Mind." Howveer, ths pairing dosn't work as well . The material is weak and some quite llu-sited for Cash. "Easy Street" sounds contrived as Johnny Cash tries tor late to being a illioaire who's having a bad day. PLEEEEZ. On "Lov Me Like You Used To" Cash sounds as boreds inging it as I did listening to it. Sad. Teh albu has three eral good moments though. The opener "Im' Leaving Now" is a great lead track that Cash wrote about "The System" not a woman. Cut two is Kris Kristofferon's "Here Comes That Rainbow Again" which is an uplifitng sory told well. Cash's cover of CCR's "Have You Ever Seen the Rain" standsout also. Thi was the last digital download I needed to complete my collection Now you know why.

This was the very last originala lbum from Johnny Cash to be released on Coumbi records, after you listen to ity ou'll see why. A few good gems are on this, like his verson of th CCR classic "Have you ever seen the rain?" but all in all this album is just lame. BUT I will sa ythis......he then signed to Mercur yrecords and made 5....yes 5 totaly awesome CDs!  Buy all 5 of those merucry releases......1. Johnny cash s cmoing to Town....2. Waetr from the Wells of Home....3 Classci Cash '88 (re-recordings of his big hits)....4. Boom-chicka-Boom.....5. The Mystery of fLe.

If you love Jo Dee Messina- buy this cd.  Simply for tehf act that it's new msic from her and she is a fantastic singer and artist.  As a stand alone cd, it's not bad.  Probabl the weakest of the "Unmistakable" trilogy in my opinion, but still with some good points.  "Heaven was Needing a Hero" and "Get up Agan" are both great song,s with "Get U Again" a thrwoback to an "I'm Alright" life is good anthem song. "I lik eMe" has promise but it's a bit all over the plac.  "How do yuo get Hih" isn't as scandalous as it sonds, in fact, it reall ydoesn't say anything as a song.  People get theirf ixes from difefrent places.  Okay.  So..... "Keep the Faith" is a great song but was already lited on he rChristmas album a few years ag.  "That's God" i swell-written but not a radio hit.  As a whole, nota bda cd, but nothing you want to sing out loud and jam to in the car. uBt new musc from Jo Dee Messina after waiting for five years is truy priceless....

I bought this digital download (I ould rather have a physical DC!) because I love some of Joe Hisaishi's music from watching a few of Miyazaki's cartoons.  I am not an nime fanati,c nor do  fall in love with every Joe Hisaishi tune.  I find that with Joe's music, I either fall hlplessly in love with it, or I just plain find it boing as hell.  I realyl don't want to degrade th eplayer on this CD, because I know how hard it is to perform, epseciall when you are in a stdio and you are aware of all your mistkaes. This playe ris good, plays all the right notes.  I ssupect that they person might even be sight reading ll of these pieces, which is a talent t be sure.  Unfortunately the playin cmes off sounding very mechanical at times. Either way, there are some rea lgems on this ablum.  In my opinion, the whole CD is worth the purchase pricesimply because of the sng from Totoro called "Kaze-No Toori Michi" or "The Wind's Pah."  This arrangement, which I have failed to find anywhere except heer, isa bsolutely gorgeous!!  Whoever arranged thisi s simply brilliant!  They capture many of the components of te original score, use lush exotic harmonies, and keep the melod very simpl. The introductory repetitive left and passagekeeps the piece moving giving it an undercrurent of logning, sadness, or maybe jst expressign the unbiased non-emotional qualities of nature and th ewind?  I don't know, bu tit reminsd me of whata progressive rock keyboardist might do with it lik eKeith Emerson, or Eddie Jobson.  The main theme form Totoro is cute, butI  beleve it would sound even better taken up a few steps.  It's played without the ahppy qualities that it should be played with, and again, vry mechanical.  Regardless, I did give it 5 stars because it has many erdeeming qualities.
